article.headline: Boeing, Apple Inc. share losses lead Dow's 275-point fall
article.body: The Dow Jones Industrial Average is declining Tuesday afternoon with shares of Boeing and Apple Inc. delivering the stiffest headwinds for the price-weighted average. Shares of Boeing BA, -0.39% and Apple Inc. AAPL, +1.74% have contributed to the blue-chip gauge's intraday decline, as the Dow DJIA, +0.56% was most recently trading 277 points, or 1.0%, lower. Boeing's shares are off $10.29, or 6.0%, while those of Apple Inc. are off $2.87, or 2.5%, combining for an approximately 87-point drag on the Dow. Microsoft MSFT, +2.48%, American Express AXP, +0.26%, and Home Depot HD, +0.49% are also contributing significantly to the decline. A $1 move in any one of the 30 components of the index results in a 6.58-point swing. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
